title: Far right continues to gain ground in French public opinion
subhed: France is divided, with half the population anxious about the rise of the Rassemblement National, and half enthusiastic about the solutions it claims to offer, according to an annual survey conducted by the Verian institute for Le Monde.

title: Trump threatens Cuba, Havana says its people are 'ready to defend the homeland'
Teyana Taylor, Jenna Ortega dazzle on the Golden Globes red carpet
Greenland's prime minister calls for unity in face of Washington's threats
subhed: In March 2025, Jens-Frederik Nielsen, an ex-badminton champion and Demokraatit (center-right) party head, became Greenland's youngest premier, at 34. Facing Donald Trump's threats, he has called for dialogue.

title: Israeli army strikes south Lebanon after warning
subhed: Israel has kept up regular strikes in Lebanon despite a November 2024 ceasefire that sought to end more than a year of hostilities between it and Hezbollah. The Israeli army announced on Sunday it had carried out strikes 'in response to Hezbollah's continuous violations of the ceasefire understandings.'

title: Californian billionaires flee potential one-off 5% wealth tax
subhed: In 2024, California had 255 billionaires, more than any other state. A state ballot initiative aimed at taxing the state's wealthiest residents could be put to a public vote in autumn 2026.
byline: By Arnaud Leparmentier (San Francisco (United States) correspondent)

title: Inside the Paris workshop where hats take shape
subhed: Founded in 1936 in Paris, Maison Michel continues the artisanal tradition of millinery. With the recent in-house addition of the rare skill of formiers, hat block makers, the Chanel-owned brand now oversees every step of production, enabling boundless experimentation. Determined to make hats a modern accessory, Artistic Director Priscilla Royer relishes this newfound freedom.

title: Greenland's parties reject American rule after latest Trump threat

EU Commission considers enacting the EU-Mercosur trade deal before MEPs ratify it
The Ukrainian-held Donbas, a land of ruins and grief
subhed: This region in eastern Ukraine now has only 200,000 inhabitants, compared to five million before the Russian invasion of 2022. Le Monde visited the area still under Kyiv's authority.

title: In Los Angeles, one year after the fires: 'I will only live here if the neighborhood is rebuilt to withstand fire'
subhed: One year after massive wildfires devastated the southern coast of California, residents are laser-focused on rebuilding. But as they weigh the need for speed against the desire to build back better, they confront questions about the best way to preserve their quality of life.

title: The new luxury olive oils: 'Visitors come with the same curiosity as for wine'
subhed: Olive oil has gained a new status. Championed by Michelin-starred chefs, the ingredient is now treated with the same reverence as a fine vintage wine, reflecting a precious artisanal craft. A handful of French estates are distinguishing themselves, selling their extra virgin production at premium prices.

title: France's narrow path toward a budget
